qas.question: Who claims the hands were pierced?
The Romans tried to affix by avoiding what?
What other location is offered by the Greek?
What other way to affix to the cross is there?
Do theories say if Destot's bones were fractured?
What bones are the radius and ulna located between?
What did Destot use instead of nails to avoid fracturing bones?
What was the nationality of Destot?
What other location does Destot believe was used for crucifixion?

context: The placing of the nails in <a0_0>the hands, or the wrists<a0_0/> is also <b5_0>uncertain<b5_0/>. Some theories suggest that <a1_0>the <b8_0>Greek<b8_0/><a1_0/> word cheir (χειρ) for hand includes the wrist and that the Romans were generally trained to place nails through Destot's space (between <b6_0>the capitate and lunate bones<b6_0/>) <a2_0>without fracturing any bones<a2_0/>. Another theory suggests that the Greek word for hand also includes the <a3_0>forearm<a3_0/> and that the nails were placed near the radius and ulna of the <b9_0>forearm<b9_0/>. <a4_0><b7_0>Ropes<b7_0/><a4_0/> may have also been used to fasten the hands in addition to the use of nails.
